availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Town in Woodford County, Kentucky. Location of Robert Aitcheson Alexander's huge livestock breeding farm. A once-busy freight station and post office on the Lexington & Ohio Railroad, 5 1/2 miles north of Versailles. Settled early by Alexanders, Blackburns, and other families. Railroad came through in 1833. Post office established May 6, 1856.

bibl.p: William Preston Mangum, A Kingdom for the Horse: The Legacy of R.A. Alexander and Woodburn Farms (Harmony House Publishers, 1999) (preview accessed on google books)
Robert M. Rennick, Kentucky Place Names (Lexington: The University Press of Kentucky, 1984), 280.
